prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Surface** 1. **Create a new coordinate system:** The origin of the coordinate system should be at (0, 0, 0) with euler angles (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). 2. **Draw the 2D sketch:** On the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, draw a sketch to create a shape as follows: - Draw a line segment from (0, 0) to (0.7174, 0). - Follow this line segment with an arc, starting at (0.7174, 0), with a midpoint at (0.7404, 0.0096) and ending at (0.75, 0.0326). - Draw a line segment from (0.75, 0.0326) to (0.75, 0.613). - Follow this line segment with an arc, starting at (0.75, 0.613), with a midpoint at (0.7404, 0.6361) and ending at (0.7174, 0.6457). - Draw a line segment from (0.7174, 0.6457) to (0, 0.6457). - Follow this line segment with an arc, starting at (0, 0.6457), with a midpoint at (0.027, 0.6326) and ending at (0.041, 0.6126). - Draw a line segment from (0.041, 0.6126) to (0.041, 0.0474). - Follow this line segment with an arc, starting at (0.041, 0.0474), with a midpoint at (0.027, 0.0244) and ending at (0, 0.013). - Draw a line segment from (0, 0.013) to (0, 0). The sketch should have a loop with 8 line and arc segments, each connected end-to-end. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch:** applying a scaling factor of 0.75. 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch:** Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal by 0.013 units, and create a new solid body. Thus, creating a rectangular prism with a curved surface at the top. The length, width, and height of the part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 (75% of the original dimensions) - Width: 0.75 (75% of the original dimensions) - Height: 0.013 (0.013 units) (Note: Refer to the JSON for specific values specified in the example)</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles are set to 0° in all three axes ([0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and the translation vector is set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.375]. This will position and orient the coordinate system for the first part. Create the Sketch The first face (face_1) contains two loops. The loops will be created one at a time. Make sure to create them in the correct order to ensure proper layering. Loop 1: 1. Create a circle (circle_1) with the center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375 units. Loop 2: 1. Create a circle (circle_1) with the center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.25 units. Scale the Sketch The entire sketch needs to be scaled by a factor of 0.75. Extrude and Combine 1. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch by 0.0625 units along the normal direction ("extrude_depth_towards_normal") and do not extrude in the opposite direction ("extrude_depth_opposite_normal"). 2. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch ("sketch_scale"). 3. Perform a join operation ("operation": "JoinFeatureOperation") with any previous CAD models to integrate this part into the assembly. Part 2 Instructions Create Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the same rotation (0° in all axes) as the previous part. The translation vector should be set to [0.0625, 0.0625, 0.375] for this second part. Create the Sketch This part will also consist of a single face (face_1) with two loops. Loop 1: 1. Create a circle (circle_1) with the center at [0.3125, 0.3125] and a radius of 0.3125 units. Loop 2: 1. Create a circle (circle_1) with the center at [0.3125, 0.3125] and a radius of 0.25 units. Scale the Sketch The entire sketch needs to be scaled by a factor of 0.625. Extrude and Combine 1. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch by 0 units along the normal direction ("extrude_depth_towards_normal") and 0.375 units in the opposite direction. 2. Apply a scaling factor of 0.625 to the sketch ("sketch_scale"). 3. Perform a join operation ("operation": "JoinFeatureOperation") with any previous CAD models to integrate this part into the assembly. These instructions will create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the bottom, sharp and straight top and bottom edges, and a central hole that runs through its length, consistent with the provided description.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Construct the first part of the final shape** The first part of the final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0265]. **Sketching the first face:** The first face consists of 4 lines. * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5227, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.5227, 0.0], End Point [0.5227, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.5227, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Extruding the first face:** Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0133 towards the normal and 0.0133 in the opposite direction of the normal. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and a translation vector of [0.053, 0.0455, 0.0]. **Sketching the second face:** The second face consists of 4 lines. * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3409, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.3409, 0.0], End Point [0.3409, 0.0455] * Line 3: Start Point [0.3409, 0.0455], End Point [0.0, 0.0455] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0455], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Extruding the second face:** Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0 in the normal direction and 0.0379 in the opposite direction of the normal. Apply a sketch scale of 0.3409. This will create the second part of the final shape. ** Building the final shape ** The final shape is the combination of the two parts constructed above. The first part is joined with the second part. This will create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, with a curved side. The final dimensions of the shape are as follows: * Length: 0.5227 units * Width: 0.3409 units * Height: 0.0643 units (0.0265 + 0.0378)</description>
